episode_title: 602 - The One Where Ross Hugs Rachel

content.description: Central Perk, it’s the same scene from the end of last week’s show. Phoebe and Rachel are sitting on the couch as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, so did everything go okay with the annulment?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah, no problems. It’s all taken care of.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, thank you. Hey, do you guys wanna go see a movie?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, umm, I’m gonna get my sweater. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Sits down next to Phoebe.) You uh, you wanna hear something weird?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Always.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I didn’t get the annulment.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re still married! Don’t tell Rachel. See you later. (He gets up leaving Phoebe in shock.)
[Cut to outside Central Perk.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, do you have any gum?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh? Yeah! Sure!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait! Wait! Hi! Listen, Ross can I just talk to you for just a second?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh but Phoebe, we’re gonna be late for the movie.
(A cab pulls up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, there’s a cab! Taxi!! (The cab stops and she opens the door.) Good timing, my God, huh? Here you go. (Pushes Rachel in and closes the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we’re, we’re actually just gonna walk ‘cause it’s right up there at the Angelica.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, the Angelica!! Go! Go! (She bangs on the cab’s roof and it pulls away.) (To Ross) You didn’t get the annulment?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I tried! But when I got to my lawyer’s office all I could hear was, “Three divorces. Three divorces!” Look, I just don’t want my tombstone to read, Ross Geller, Three Divorces.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t be worried about that! Your tombstone can say whatever you want it to say! It could say, Ross Geller, Good at Marriage! Y’know? Mine’s gonna say Phoebe Buffay, Buried Alive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, all I know is I-I can’t have another failed marriage!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So okay what? You’re gonna be married to a girl who doesn’t even know about it?!—Op, woman ! Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, okay so, I don’t have it all worked out quite yet. Just don’t say anything to Rachel, please?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel is one of my closest friends. (Pause) Although, being the only one who knows anything about this does makes me feel special. Okay!
(Rachel’s cab backs up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, stop-stop! Phoebe?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What was that?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry, mix up. Hey, how was the movie?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I haven’t seen it yet!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well then you’d better hurry! The Angelica! Go! Go! (Bangs on the roof again and off they go.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noooooooo!!

{Transciber’s note: In case you’re wondering, and I know you are. Their names are all back to normal. Just in a slightly smaller font than usual to allow Courteney Cox Arquette to fit on one line and not be smaller than the rest of their names. Now, on with the show…}

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Monica are cuddling on the couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know when we move in together, can I get a gumball machine?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course! Joey wouldn’t let you have one?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. When it comes to sweets, he’s surprisingly strict.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, have you figured out a way to tell him you’re moving out?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, I keep trying, y’know? I can get out, “Joey, I have too…” but then I lose my nerve and I always finish with, “…go to the bathroom.” He may think I’m sick.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I really have to tell Rachel, but I… We just have to get it over with! Y’know, the next time we see them we’re just gonna tell them. Okay? That’s it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so that’s this is gonna work now? You’re just gonna order me around all the time?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pretty much.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey man, you feeling any better? (Chandler answers him with some guttural sounds that only he can make and that no human can transcribe.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, we have something to tell you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! You’re pregnant!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-o-o! (To Monica) No? (She nods no.) No-o-o! Look Joey, here’s the thing, Monica and I have decided to live together, here. So, I’m gonna be moving out man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! (Tearing up) Well, uh… Hey! I’m really happy for you guys! Congratulations! (Kisses Monica on the cheek) See you later. (Starts for the door on the verge of tears as Monica stops him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait! Joey! Joey! Are you okay?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I gotta go! I got an acting job. (Turns towards the door, pauses, and turns back.) Like you’d believe that. This sucks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I-I’m just gonna be right across the hall and I promise you, the minute Monica and I break up I’m moving right back in with you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! Look-look-look, uh, if you’re gonna be moving in with him I feel it’s my responsibility to tell you the truth about him! Okay? He’s a terrible roommate! Terrible! He uh, forgets to umm… Oh-oh he always, he always umm—Oh, who am I kidding! He’s the best roommate ever! (Hugs Chandler.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is on the couch as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, have you seen Rachel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have some pretty exciting news!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re pregnant!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Chandler and I are moving in together!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! That’s good! Wow! But now if you were pregnant, what would you name it? Hint: Phoebe.
(Ross returns from getting some coffee.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well umm, Chandler and I are moving in together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God. Ohh, my little sister and my best friend…shaking up. Oh, that’s great. That’s great. (Kisses and hugs her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Guys, I’m happy too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, come here! (Phoebe joins them in the hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Big day huh? People moving in, people getting annulled… (Winks at Ross.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I gotta go find Rachel but umm, if you guys see her could you please try to give her some really bad news so that mine doesn’t seem so bad? (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, something bad to tell Rachel… Bad news for Rachel, what could that be?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Could ya just, could ya just lay off, please? All right? My life is an embarrassment! I should go live under somebody’s stairs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, it’s not that big a deal! So you’ll been divorced three times, you’ll still have a life, you’ll go on dates…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No, I won’t! I’ll be at the bottom of the dating barrel now. The only guys below me will be Four Divorce Guy uh, Murderer Guy, and-and, Geologists.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, you’re being ridiculous! Okay? You are cute and smart and sweet and that is much more important than three stupid divorces!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah? Have you ever dated anyone who has been divorced three times?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know that’s really fair. Y’know? Most guys who have been divorced three times are like 60. Ross, nobody cares about this except you! This-this embarrassment thing is all in your head! Here, I’ll show you! Come here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! Why?

(She grabs his arm and drags him over to a table where three beautiful women are sitting. Now, I’m going to go out on a limb and say that their names are Stephanie, Karin, and Meg. Okay, so I looked at the credits. Of course, only Meg is named later on, so I’ll have to guess who is Stephanie and who is Karin. But, we’ll cross that bridge when we come to it.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! Hi! Listen, my friend Ross is about to be divorced for the third time, but wouldn’t you date him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And if you wait right here, I’ll go get Ross. (Phoebe grabs his arm and prevents him from escaping.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is pacing anxiously waiting for Rachel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh, I thought you were Rachel!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What gave me away?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just tell her, I have to get it over with. I told Ross and Phoebe and she’s the only one left!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so that’s it, everybody knows! It’s official, we’re moving in together. No turning back. Are ya scared? Are ya?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow that was my scariest voice! You’re very brave.
(They hug as Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, the worse day! Y’know, you think you’re making progress at work and then your boss calls you Raquel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey listen, for the first four years of my work everybody called me Sha-la-lap. (Awkward silence ensues.) Seriously.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I believe you. So, it was right in the middle of a staff meeting so of course no one else wants to correct her so everyone else is calling me Raquel! By the end of the day, the mailroom guys were calling me Rocky!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I-I still think you’re very-very nice and very pretty…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All yours babe. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have a seat. (They sit at the table.) Okay, listen umm, Chandler and I are going to live together, here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! That’s so great! I’m so happy for you guys!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And that was so sweet of you to ask! Oh my God, the three of us are gonna have such a good time living together!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, we are. (Chandler is frantically trying to get Monica to correct her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And Chandler, you’re gonna have to watch those long showers you take in the morning because you know Raquel can’t be late.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rach…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, he’s gonna work on that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! This is so exciting! Oh God… (Gasps and starts to sing) Come and knock on my door …

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll be waiting for you …

{Transciber’s note: I’ll finish that one for those of you who don’t know what they’re talking about. Where the towels are Hers and Hers and His, Three’s Company too! Yeah, that’s the theme song for Three’s Company.}

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is hosting an impromptu roundtable discussion with Stephanie, Karin, and Meg about Ross’s three divorces.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …once you know the stories, it’s not that bad. First marriage, wife’s hidden sexuality, not my fault. Second marriage, said the wrong name at the altar, a little my fault. Third marriage, well they really shouldn’t allow you to get married when you’re that drunk and have writing all over your face, Nevada’s fault.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so what do you think ladies? Who wouldn’t be interested? Who wouldn’t want to date him?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Well the divorces don’t bother me, I’d date him. But, not while he’s still married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, what about you? (Points to Karin) Wouldn’t you want a date?

content.speaker: Karin
content.text: Actually, I’m dating at all anymore. See, I figured out that I was only dating guys that were like y’know bad for me, so until I work that out…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whatever! What about you Meg?

content.speaker: Meg
content.text: Well, I don’t care about the divorces either, but I wouldn’t date him. It’s just that he’s obviously still in love with this Rachel girl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She said, “He’s obviously still in love with this Rachel girl.” (He glares at her.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is crazy! I mean, yes-yes Rachel is my good friend and I-I have loved her in the past, but now , she is just my wife! Phoebe, will you-will you help me out here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I thought you loved her when you-when you married her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We were drunk! I would’ve married uh, Joey with that amount of alcohol!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! You could do a lot worse than Joey Tribbiani!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I’m sorry, but you guys are wrong. I just don’t want to be divorced three times.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, and now he’s using this three divorces reason because he wants to stay married to her because he loves her. I must say, “Well done!” Bravo Meg.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Fine! Fine! If-if this is what you think, forget about the whole three divorce thing! Okay, I-I’ll go to my lawyer’s office right now and get this marriage annulled! Okay?! Because she means nothing to me! Noth—(leans down to Meg’s ear)—Nothing!!

content.speaker: Meg
content.text: Okay now I wouldn’t date you because you seem a little creepy.

content.speaker: Karin
content.text: I am so attracted to him right now.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Monica are still debating about how to tell Rachel that Chandler’s moving in and she’s moving out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, when are we gonna tell Rachel what is actually gonna happen?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Soon! I-I just couldn’t before. You saw how upset Joey got! I couldn’t do that to her, she’s my best friend!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, Joey’s my best friend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not your best friend?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You just said… Of course you’re my best friend. Would you please tell Rachel though?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, all right, at least I’m prepared.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (She grabs a tin of freshly baked cookies) Oh yes. (He reaches for one.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: These aren’t for you! Are you upset?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am now!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey roomie!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, bye! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, there’s something uh, important I have to tell you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you pregnant?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! But, I’m throwing this shirt away! I think there was a little misunderstanding before.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, when I said that uh, that Chandler and I wanted to umm, live together we meant alone together.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh, that’s funny, I can’t believe I did that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no sweetie, no! This is my fault, I wasn’t clear! I’m really sorry. And listen, you take as much time as you need to move out okay? There’s absolutely no rush.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Sits back and resumes her reading.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Don’t you want a cookie?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure? (Monica hands her one.) Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe, do you need a tissue?
(Rachel mumbles uh-huh and spits the half-eaten cookie out onto the tissue.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, where did you get these?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I made them!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, good God, they’re so yummy! (She re-ingests the previously expelled cookie matter from the tissue.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is packing some books and Joey is watching him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: God, it’s gonna so weird like when I come home and you’re not here. Y’know? No more Joey and Chan’s. No more J and C’s. “You wanna go over to Joey and Chandler’s?” “Can’t, its not there.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I’m just gonna be across the hall, we can still do all the same stuff.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah but we won’t be able to like get up in the middle of the night and have those long talks about our feelings and the future.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not once did we do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So I, I told Rachel it was just gonna be the two of us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah? Well, how’d she take it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really well. Yeah. Surprisingly well. Yeah, she didn’t cry. She wasn’t angry or sad. (Sits down, slightly disgusted.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you’re upset because you didn’t make your best friend cry?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean, all I’m asking for is just a little emotion! Is that too much to ask after six years?! I mean what? Are-are-are Rachel and I not as close as you guys?! I mean do we not have as much fun?! Don’t I deserve a few tears?!! I mean we-we told Joey, he cried his eyes out!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I did not cry my eyes out!! Come on! It’s like the end of an era! No more J-man and Channie’s!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I gotta ask, who calls us that?!

content.description: Ross’s lawyer’s office, his name is Russell and has just been told by Ross about his current situation.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: You got married again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: So that’s your second marriage in two years.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, second in two years. Third overall.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: Ross, I have been a divorce attorney for 23 years and never had I so much business from one client. Why don’t you tell me what happened.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Basically, Rachel and I were in Vegas and we got drunk…

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: I’m sorry, is this the same Rachel who’s name you said at the altar in the second marriage?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes-yes-yes! But, I-I do not love her.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: Oh, that’s better then.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This was just a drunken mistake and I need to get it annulled.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: I see. Have you considered therapy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think just the annulment for today.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: There are a couple of forms to fill out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Easy.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: And we’ll need to have witnesses who can testify that you were not of uh, sound mind.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No problem.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: And we’ll need you and Rachel to testify before a judge.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ooh! There’s no way to do this without her? ‘Cause I kinda all ready told her uh, it was, it was already taken care of.

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: Of course you did. Look Ross, you can’t get an annulment unless you and Rachel are both there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-ha, what about someone who looks like Rachel? (Russell glares at him.) I will think about the therapy.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is painting her toe nails as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. So um, I was thinking that maybe we should start dividing up our stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, no point in dragging it out. Dragging out the long process of you moving out and us not living together anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, what about this? (She holds up a chrome 5-point star.) Huh? Who-who gets this? See, I don’t know if I want it because it might be y’know, too many memories!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What the hell is that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know. (Picks up a big plate from the coffee table.) Hey, Rachel, you want the big plate? I want you to have the big plate.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Mon, thanks! I love this plate!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Something to remember me by!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon, honey you’re not dying. I’m just moving out. Y’know, I mean we’re gonna see each other all the time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But still, it’s a big change. The end of an era, you might say!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you okay? You’re not blinking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m fine! I just, I’m thinking how much it’s an end of era.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, all right. But y’know I gotta say, I don’t, I don’t think six years counts as an era.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: An era is defined as a significant period of time. Now, it was significant to me, maybe it wasn’t significant to you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is the matter with you?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is the matter with you?!! Why aren’t you more upset?! Aren’t you gonna be sad that we’re not gonna be living together anymore?! I mean aren’t you gonna miss me at all?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, fine, but don’t get mad at me. It’s-it’s just a little hard to believe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s hard to believe?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know, it’s you guys. You-you do this kind of stuff! Y’know? I mean, you-you were gonna get married in Vegas and then you backed out! I guess I’m not upset because I don’t see you guys going through with it. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, it’s going to happen. Chandler is gonna move in here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no, wait! Just let me finish, okay? This isn’t something that we just, we just impulsively decided in-in Vegas, this is something we both really want. And it is going to happen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It is? Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, sweetie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean we’re not, we’re not gonna live together anymore?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Oh my God! I’m gonna miss you so much! (Starts to cry.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna miss you! (They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean it’s the end of an era!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!

content.description: The hallway, Ross is coming up the stairs as Phoebe leaves Joey and Chandler’s.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, bye!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So? Did you get the annulment?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I couldn’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I knew it! Because you love Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s not that. Okay? Annulments are more complicated than I…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, complicated ‘cause of the love.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I… I do, I do not love Rachel. I’m gonna tell her right now about the whole thing so we can get this marriage annulled as fast as possible. Okay? Would I do that if I loved her?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ve never been more convinced of your love for her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do not have feelings for Rachel! Okay?! (He goes into her apartment.)
[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s as Ross walks through the door. Rachel is holding the chrome star and crying.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, what’s wrong?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica and Chandler are really moving in here and I have to move out and everything is changing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my—Come here! Come here! (He hugs her.) It’s okay. Everything’s gonna be okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course.
(Ross suddenly realizes something.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are talking.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, Ross and Rachel got married, Monica and Chandler almost got married, do you think you and I should hook up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh we do, but not just yet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?! Well, when?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay umm, well, first Chandler and Monica will get married and be filthy rich by the way. Yeah. But it won’t work out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. Then, I’m gonna marry Chandler for the money and you’ll marry Rachel and have the beautiful kids.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But then we ditch those two and that’s when we get married. We’ll have Chandler’s money and Rachel’s kids and getting custody will be easy because of Rachel’s drinking problem.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh, what about Ross?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t want to go into the whole thing, but umm, we have words and I kill him.
